trailingComments.value: Only include errors in response if application environment
is not set to 'production'.  In production, we shouldn't
send back any identifying information about errors.

leadingComments.value: Only include errors in response if application environment
is not set to 'production'.  In production, we shouldn't
send back any identifying information about errors.

trailingComments.value: If the user-agent wants JSON, always respond with JSON

leadingComments.value: If the user-agent wants JSON, always respond with JSON

trailingComments.value: If second argument is a string, we take that to mean it refers to a view.
If it was omitted, use an empty object (`{}`)

leadingComments.value: If second argument is a string, we take that to mean it refers to a view.
If it was omitted, use an empty object (`{}`)

trailingComments.value: If a view was provided in options, serve it.
Otherwise try to guess an appropriate view, or if that doesn't
If no second argument provided, try to serve the default view,
but fall back to sending JSON(P) if any errors occur.

arguments.value: res.forbidden() :: Could not locate view for error page (sending JSON instead).  Details:

arguments.raw: 'res.forbidden() :: When attempting to render error page view, an error occured (sending JSON instead).  Details: '

• If the view was missing, ignore the error but provide a verbose log.
If a view error occured, fall back to JSON(P).

comments.value: Only include errors in response if application environment
is not set to 'production'.  In production, we shouldn't
send back any identifying information about errors.
If the user-agent wants JSON, always respond with JSON
If second argument is a string, we take that to mean it refers to a view.
If it was omitted, use an empty object (`{}`)
If a view was provided in options, serve it.
Otherwise try to guess an appropriate view, or if that doesn't
If no second argument provided, try to serve the default view,
but fall back to sending JSON(P) if any errors occur.
If a view error occured, fall back to JSON(P).
• If the view was missing, ignore the error but provide a verbose log.
Otherwise, if this was a more serious error, log to the console with the details.
